reasoning: Osteosarcoma is the most common primary bone malignancy in children and adolescents. Incidence approximately 3-4 per million children per year, or ~0.3 per 100k of pediatric population.
source: Mirabello L et al. (2009). Osteosarcoma incidence and survival rates from 1973 to 2004. Cancer. 115(7):1531-1543
